title: How would you describe popular Quorans in one sentence? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ed Gamble: Your friendly neighbourhood Quoran Becky Puckett: Cheetos, more Cheetos, SOMEONE GET ME SOME CHEETOS Habib Fanny: You like socks? Well not as much as me. I’m the guy that shows doctors can be fun Allen Kinney: I write funny things about my childhood, not to forget bout STER WERS Robert Puckett: Always remember, lukewarm noodles is the way Naima Naji: I’m totally sane *wink* Justin William: Sitting back and enjoying quora with a glass of chill User-13048486796220502648: Representing all teenager brains since 2018 onwards User-11238777555976271851: I can beat up Ryan Ryan Leslie: Nuh uh, who said I can’t beat you? Namit Bathla: Know what’s wrong with Earth without having to read huge articles Sarhad Choudhary: Popularity matters not, I’m there for you whether you’re a peasant or royalty Aniket Bhardwaj: Everything wrong with Indian politics and some light hearted quora insults Honourable mentions (people who deserve to have more followers) Mallika Handa: Answering you’re A2A’s in the most messed up way possible Chloe Russell: KPOP, Kangaroo and Pineapple Pizza Keerthi M: Sarcasm at its finest User-10485190228675275355: I like learning new things Samiksha Pathak: Master of short stories and words User-13495553970528561946: Reading between the lines like a pro User-13581352747306148904: History answers on fleek, follow for interesting historical facts User-10601827257558320401: The one introvert you can actually relate to Sorry for the long answer and hope you enjoyed

Robert Frost waxes comic with astronomical panache, but gets regularly ticked at the “altitude” of some followers. Oscar Tay really loves PIE; often caught rubbing hands together with unbridled enthusiasm. Dave Consiglio just wishes Everyone Would Die Already; no one listens for lack of personal Chemistry.
